results.title: Open university: the curriculum - context, design and development course
results.creator_credit: Gwyn Pritchard, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: The concept of openness in higher education is examined. The film looks at the Open Admissions Policy at the City University of New York. It focuses on the implications for a university of having an open admissions policy. In particular the film examines how the abandonment of traditional selection practices affects the curriculum of the university.

results.title: Open to view: British country houses
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Anthony Gilkison and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: Some of the historic castles and houses of Britain. The island castle of St Michael’s Mount in Cornwall; Stokesay Castle in Shropshire; the great house at Chastleton; Chatsworth, where the Dukes of Devonshire have gathered art treasures; Castle Code in Northern Ireland. A visit to Windsor Castle.

results.title: Open to the Sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
One of a series of films about Gippsland, which gives an insight into this region and shows the full scope of natural phenomenon. Where the river meets the sea, new designs in environmental geography appear

results.title: Open sesame: Dubrovnik
results.creator_credit: Joe O'Brien and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Dubrovnik lies at the centre of Yugoslavia’s tourist development which stretches for over a hundred miles of sea coast. The United Nations representative works to preserve the natural wild beauty of the Adriatic Coast and the man-made beauty of the ancient white stone buildings and monuments.

results.title: Open school (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the experimental Parkway program in secondary education in Philadelphia. There are no permanent school buildings and students find their classrooms, curricula and many of the teachers from among community resources.

results.title: Open plan (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson, New Zealand. Dept. of Education and Zero 16 Films
results.brief_description: In New Zealand open plan generally refers to a style of building designed to accommodate open education methods. The film is set in one room with four teachers and 120 children between the ages of five and seven years. The children work in various groupings, or by themselves, in small reading groups, and in team teaching situations. Dancing and singing are also shown. The four teachers tell how they work together, and discuss the problems they strike, and the advantages they see in the system. Suitable for teacher/tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dave Gibson, New Zealand. Dept. of Education and Zero 16 Films

results.title: Open Learning
results.creator_credit: Trish Pilley and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: The open learning (or Open TAFE) concept means basing the course on a learning need of the particular student rather than needs of the institution. It allows students to study off-campus and in their own time. The differences between ‘open’ and ‘closed’ (or traditional learning) are mentioned. Introduced and narrated by Peter Couchman
results.creator_credit_for_label: Trish Pilley and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education

results.title: Open house
results.brief_description: A study of some of the famous English country houses which lie near to London and which are open to the public. Sutton Place, Polesden Lacey, Knole, Penshurst Place, West Wycombe Park and Hatfield House are among those shown.

results.title: Open heart surgery
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom, Michael Sklar, CBS News Production and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: An operation on a five-year-old girl with a “hole in the heart” performed by Dr C. Walton Lillehei at the University of Minnesota hospital. Shows a special “heart-lung” machine which enables doctors to operate without interrupting the patient’s blood circulation. Suitable only for members of the medical and nursing professions and students of such professions.
